blog.name: loveandsupportforcaptainmarvel
blog.title: Captain Marvel Doesn't Care For Your Sexism
blog.description: Blog dedicated to standing up to the hate directed at Captain Marvel

summary: Brie Larson does not hate men. Just because someone is a feminist, doesn’t mean they hate men. Brie was calling for more...
body:
Brie Larson does not hate men. Just because someone is a feminist, doesn’t mean they hate men. Brie was calling for more diversity in her press interviews, more diversity in Hollywood. Men flipped out over that so much that she had to explain that she didn’t want to take away what they had, just open up more seats for people. Feminists shouldn’t have to explain that we don’t hate men. Seriously, it makes me angry that feminism, a movement to raise women to equal standing as men, still somehow has to be made into something all about men by these guys who need everything to be about them. I can’t even tell you how many times I’ve needed to explain how feminism benefits men as well to try to get men to see the good of it, like how Brie needed to explain her call for more diversity. It’s like anytime anything has something to do with women, these men come along and bitch about how it’s not about them and that women must hate men. This is why Brie commented that she doesn’t think men should review a movie starring women because it wasn’t meant for them. She wants more women to be heard, more people of color to be heard. 

Also, Brie’s male co-stars do not hate her. People who hate her are trying to blow these interviews way out of proportion. They just can’t handle a woman who is sarcastic and doesn’t give a shit about what people think of her. If her co-stars did hate her, then that’s their problem, that’s not Brie’s problem because she hasn’t done anything to them. 

I’m gonna say this once. I don’t hate men. But when all of my experiences with men have been them accusing me of hating them because I’m a feminist, or just them treating me shitty, I get pretty damn close to hating them. These aren’t isolated experiences, this is something every woman has experienced. Feminists don’t hate men, but there are a lot of reasons why we could. 

And if a woman does say she hates men, instead of getting pissed off at her and explaining why you’re such a “stand-up guy”, try to understand why she feels like this. Chances are every experience she’s had with a man has been horrible.

summary:
Chris Evans: I'm done with the MCU
Russo Brothers: lol okay 
Russo Brothers: *destroy Captain America's previous character...
body:
Chris Evans: I’m done with the MCU

Russo Brothers: lol okay

Russo Brothers: *destroy Captain America’s previous character development by showing he’d be perfectly willing to sit on the sidelines while Hydra took over Shield, Bucky got tortured into insanity, and Thanos hunted down the Infinity Stones, but make the whole thing a giant plot hole that they admit is a plot hole with no explanation so it technically can be undone without too much difficulty*

Chris Evans: … I’m still not coming back, screw you guys

blog.name: abarcaart
blog.title: Abarca Art
blog.description: I love to design! From Fashion to Character Design to Advance Graphic Interface, I will be sharing my designs and open to feedback. Please share your opinion.

summary: INFLUENCER: CHRIS BACHALO
title: INFLUENCER: CHRIS BACHALO
body:
For today’s influencer, I chose Chris Bachalo. He is a Canadian born, California raised comic book artist that draws for Marvel, currently Dr. Strange comic series. I first got introduced to Chris’s artwork in the Generation X comics. It was cool to be introduced to these new X-Men characters during my high school years. What made his art standout, was his simplistic look. It had an anime style but still remain western comic art. The same reason I like Joe Madureira’s art was the same reason that drew me to Chris’s. In fact, according to Wikipedia, Chris was heavily influenced by Joe’s anime stylish art. I’m a big fan of Chris’s style along the years. It gets more and more simple. It is the shapes that make his art standout. Also, the expression on the characters he draws. Sometimes artists will draw dynamic characters doing badass poses but their facial expressions look stoic, emotionless, no language. His facial expressions speak to the character’s persona. Check out his art, as well as, his video on drawing Psylocke. Leave a commit if you like him or if you don’t.

www.AbarcaArt.com

IG: Guece

Tumblr: Abarca Art

summary: Unpopular opinion
title: Unpopular opinion
body:
EMH is better than Avengers Assemble. I love them both, but one should not have died so the other could live.

A. It had Wasp.

B. It was Stony central.

C. It cared a lot more about character and continuity and dialogue.

D. Bucky was in it for more than 2 seconds.

E. Clintasha is canon.

F. While Falcon gets barely a mention, they didn’t go the turn-him-into-spiderman route and then have to fix their mistake several seasons down the road.

G. Red Skull is Steve’s arch-nemesis, not Tony’s.

H. Captain Marvel isn’t weird and mean.

I. miss it so much.
